title: Man shoots self in foot as he checks into Hanover Township hotel
content:
A man checking into the Best Western Lehigh Valley Hotel on Friday night shot himself in the foot when his pocket knife pulled the trigger on the pistol in his pants, police said.
The handgun fired into the top of his left foot at 9:20 p.m. in the lobby of the hotel, situated at routes 512 and 22 in Hanover Township, Northampton County, police said.
The 43-year-old hotel guest from Texas was taken to St. Luke's University Hospital in Fountain Hill with non-life-threatening injuries.
"He was checking in at the hotel and he had his handgun loaded in his pants pocket," Colonial Regional police officer Thomas Mahalick said. "It was not in a holster, and a pocket knife pressed the trigger and set it off."
A hotel clerk was in the lobby at the time but was not hurt. Mahalick said the wounded Texan spilled little blood as he left the lobby to await paramedics outside.
"Almost all of the blood was kept in his shoe," he said. "There was one drop of blood in the lobby and that was it."
Hanover Township EMS and Bethlehem Township paramedics rushed to the scene and checked the injury. Hanover EMS took the man to the hospital.
"He'll probably be in there for a little while," Mahalick said.
The man will not be charged, he said.
"It was an accident," he explained. "Nobody else was hurt. No one else was in danger. He has his concealed-carry license, reciprocating with Pennsylvania."
The man was checking into the hotel as part of his relocation from Texas for a job, Mahalick said.
— Frank Warner
